channel.title: Iraq insurgents 'hack into video feeds from US drones'
channel.description:
http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/8419147.stm
'The hacking was possible because the remotely flown planes have an unprotected communications link'
'...fighters are said to have used off-the-shelf software programs such as SkyGrabber to capture the footage'
That's quite impressive.

item.title: Iraq insurgents 'hack into video feeds from US drones'
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“Uriko, post:6, topic:320196”][quote author=MujaheD link=topic=416645.msg3064533#msg3064533 date=1261113384]

Using off-the-shelf software is impressive? In that case it’s impressive that my aunt uses windows too, right? Hacking is the wrong word to use here.

What’s impressive is that the military didn’t bother encrypting the communication with the plane, you could use ‘off-the-shelf’ software for that too, what a stupid move.

Yeah I didn’t mean using off the-shelf-software was impressive.
[/quote]i think u did[/quote]
lul

Read full topic
item.source: Iraq insurgents 'hack into video feeds from US drones'
